block.p: Alicia Suzanne Berns, a daughter of Judith Defoe Berns of Lake Katrine, N.Y., and the late Anthony D. Berns, was married yesterday to Patrick Owen Burns Jr., the son of Barbara Van Riper Burns and Mr. Burns of Brooklyn. The Rev. Nils Blatz performed the ceremony at Grace Episcopal Church in Brooklyn.
Mr. and Mrs. Burns, both 30, graduated from Boston University, but did not meet until afterward at a party in Manhattan.

The bride is a product manager at Donna Karan Intimates in Manhattan, a division of Wacoal, a lingerie company. Her father was the vice president of the Iron Gate Products Company, a former food importer in the Bronx. Her mother is a photographer and also does quilting and collages.
The bride is a granddaughter of the late Charles Berns, a founder of the ''21'' Club in New York.

Alicia Suzanne Berns, a daughter of Judith Defoe Berns of Lake Katrine, N.Y., and the late Anthony D. Berns, was married yesterday to Patrick Owen Burns Jr., the son of Barbara Van Riper Burns and Mr. Burns of Brooklyn. The Rev. Nils Blatz performed the ceremony at Grace Episcopal Church in Brooklyn.
Mr. and Mrs. Burns, both 30, graduated from Boston University, but did not meet until afterward at a party in Manhattan.

The bride is a product manager at Donna Karan Intimates in Manhattan, a division of Wacoal, a lingerie company. Her father was the vice president of the Iron Gate Products Company, a former food importer in the Bronx. Her mother is a photographer and also does quilting and collages.
The bride is a granddaughter of the late Charles Berns, a founder of the ''21'' Club in New York.

The bridegroom is a film editor at Consulate, an editing company for commercials and music videos in Manhattan. His father is a senior investment consultant with Early Stage Enterprises, a venture capital fund in Skillman, N.J.
